meanings.definition: The action of preventing something from happening.
meanings.sent1: Her preclusions stopped the accident from occurring.
meanings.sent2: The preclusions of the security system kept intruders out.
meanings.sent3: The preclusions of the rain on the picnic made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His preclusions against failure were like a shield.
meanings.sent5: The preclusions of the locked door were undeniable.

meanings.definition: The state of being excluded or barred from something.
meanings.sent1: His preclusions from the club saddened him.
meanings.sent2: The preclusions from the event left her feeling left out.
meanings.sent3: The preclusions from the party turned into a blessing in disguise.
meanings.sent4: Her preclusions from the group felt like a heavy weight.
meanings.sent5: The preclusions from the team were hard to accept.

meanings.definition: The act of ruling out or making impossible.
meanings.sent1: The preclusions of magic in the real world fascinated him.
meanings.sent2: His preclusions of failure drove him to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The preclusions of eating ice cream for breakfast made her chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her preclusions of ever winning the lottery were shattered.
meanings.sent5: The preclusions of time travel seemed like a distant dream.
